intro: Cheilanthes bonapartei, commonly known as the Bonaparte's rockcap, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit and features small, leathery, evergreen leaves. The plant is typically found growing on rocky substrates in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a widespread distribution across parts of Asia, Africa, and the Americas. Due to its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, it is considered a resilient and drought-tolerant species.
